a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: Logical model for medication prescription (or some other form of order)

short.value: Medication prescription (model)

definition.value: Logical model for medication prescription (or some other form of order)

short.value: Business identifier(s) for the prescription

definition.value: Business identifier(s) for the prescription

short.value: Identifier for the group that this prescription belongs to. This might be the common identifier in use cases where one national prescription contains several medication items, which can be handled as separate orders

definition.value: Identifier for the group that this prescription belongs to. This might be the common identifier in use cases where one national prescription contains several medication items, which can be handled as separate orders

short.value: The person for whom the medication is prescribed/ordered

definition.value: Question: would we want to add basic Patient model?

short.value: Time of authoring the prescription/draft in the information system

definition.value: Time of authoring the prescription/draft in the information system

short.value: What this order is based on

definition.value: This is a reference to the order that this order is based on. For example, a prescription for a medication may be based on a proposal, and an administration request may be based on a prescription.

short.value: Time of issuing (signing) the prescription by health care practicioner

definition.value: Time of issuing (signing) the prescription by health care practicioner

short.value: The recorder of the prescription/draft in the information system

definition.value: The recorder of the prescription/draft in the information system

short.value: The person who made the prescription, and who takes the responsibility of the treatment

definition.value: Question: would we want to add basic Practicioner model?

short.value: Category or categories of prescription. For example type of reimbursement, or type of prescription (e.g. hospital, private, etc).

definition.value: Category or categories of prescription. For example type of reimbursement, or type of prescription (e.g. hospital, private, etc).

short.value: Effective date of the prescription. The prescription is not dispensable before this date. In most cases this information repeats issueDate

definition.value: Effective date of the prescription. The prescription is not dispensable before this date. In most cases this information repeats issueDate

short.value: The validity period end date. The prescription is not dispensable after this date.

definition.value: The validity period end date. The prescription is not dispensable after this date.

short.value: Status of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment

definition.value: Status of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment

short.value: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid

definition.value: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid

short.value: Additional information or comments

definition.value: Additional information or comments

short.value: Prescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc

definition.value: Prescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc

short.value: Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, prophylaxis, or a procedure)

definition.value: Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, prophylaxis, or a procedure)

short.value: Reason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.

definition.value: Reason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.

short.value: Type of intent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc

definition.value: Type of intent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc

short.value: Period over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)

definition.value: Period over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)

short.value: Overall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).

definition.value: Overall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).

short.value: Dosaging and administration instructions

definition.value: Dosaging and administration instructions

short.value: Additional instructions about preparation or dispense

definition.value: Additional instructions about preparation or dispense

short.value: Whether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment line

definition.value: Whether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment line

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

requirements.value: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

isModifierReason.value: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

definition.value: The type of substitution that is allowed.

definition.value: Reason for the substitution requirement
